text.p: Monsanto Co and a unit of Rhone-Poulenc SA said early Wednesday that they have signed an agreement for the future marketing in the U.S. of certain pre-mixed corn herbicide products.
The products under the agreement contain Monsanto's Harness herbicide and Rhone-Poulenc's new herbicide, Balance, which is awaiting federal registration.
The deal is with Rhone-Poulenc's U.S. subsidiary, Rhone-Poulenc Ag Co.
The companies said that in subsequent years they expect to introduce and market separate and distinct single package pre-mixes containing Balance and Harness.
The corn market in the United States is the world's largest and herbicides used on the crop are estimated to represent more than $1.5 billion in sales annually, they said.

"This agreement to access Harness herbicide for a product pre-mixture in the corn market is a key strategic objective for introducing Balance brand isoxaflutole in the United States," Dave Downing, Rhone-Poulenc Ag Co's Balance product manager, said in a statement.
